subject: Throttle cable broke
description_text:
Have been using these for a bit and today I noticed the connector came off the end of my throttle cable. Is this rj9? And if so what is the pin order I need to terminate a new one on? 
Yahoo Mail: Search, Organize, Conquer

conversations.body_text: Hi Andrew Winningham,  The throttle uses an RJ11 4P4C connector. You can go to a nearby computer repair shop and re-crimp a connector, following the wiring sequence of the brake or clutch. This should resolve the issue.

It is 100% not an rj11 as I went out and purchased some and they were too big. It has to be an rj9 connector. 

Yahoo Mail: Search, Organize, Conquer
Hi Andrew Winningham,  The name may vary in different countries, but as long as the size is the same, it will work. However, a crimping tool is required to complete the task.
